heaviest_rainfall.status: 47.89mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 09 November 2025, marking an exceptional 144.8 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 3 cold snaps, with an average of 3.6 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 0 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (220°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.6 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.6 mm) and pressure (down 6 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and feels like temperature (down 1.8°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 35.0m higher than yesterday, 49.7m lower than the past week, 65.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 557m and a peak of 849m, averaging 706.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, the air will feel dry and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
